title: Ada and Prime
text:
As you might already know, Ada the Ladybug is a farmer. She grows many vegetables and trees and she wants to distinguish between them. For this purpose she bought some funny signs, which contains a few digits. The digits on the sign could be arbitrarily permuted (yet not added or removed). Ada likes prime numbers so she want the signs to be prime (and obviously distinct). Can you find the number of signs with prime number which could be obtained?NOTE: Number can't have leading zero!InputThe first line of input will contain1 ≤ T ≤ 10000, the number of test-cases.The nextTlines will contain1 ≤ D ≤ 9, the number of digits on sign, followed byDdigits0 ≤ di≤ 9OutputFor each test-case, output the number of distinct primes which could be generated on given sign.Example Input5
1 9
3 1 2 3
5 1 2 0 8 9
7 1 0 6 5 7 8 2
5 1 2 7 3 1Example Output0
0
11
283
15
